duck: The spins (as in having "the spins") is an adverse reaction of intoxication that causes a state of vertigo and nausea, causing one to feel as if he or she is "spinning out of control".

milestones: Taliban suicide bombing kills 37 Afghan civilians, wounds Canadian soldiers
Woman killed on amusement park ride in New York
Twelve injured in Washington after ride at fair topples over
US talk show: Daily Guinness attempts to return on talk show Live with Regis and Kelly
Aurora Borealis caused by electrical space tornadoes
Suicide bomber kills three people in Afghanistan
Truex Jr. beats Harvick in the Winn-Dixie 250
Hurricane Fred churns the Atlantic
Several police officers killed in suicide bombing in Afghanistan
Lewis Hamilton wins 2009 Hungarian Grand Prix
200 yard spider web found in Lake Tawakoni State Park, East Texas
Gallery seeks Control themed mail art for exhibit
Woman torches own house, attempting to kill spiders
Fires at Baxter Immigration Detention Centre in South Australia
Tropical storm Richard forms, drifts towards Honduras
Fernando Alonso wins 2010 Korean Grand Prix
46 illegal Afghan immigrants suffocate in truck in Pakistan
U.S. actor Charlie Sheen questions 9/11 theories
Security camera records 'unexplainable' object in Sante Fe, New Mexico
Tempers flare over New Orleans tragedy

wiki.text:
'The spins' (as in 'having "the spins"')<ref name="fsu">Diane Marie Leiva. The
[[Florida State University]] College of Education: [http://66.102.1.104/scholar-
?hl=en&lr=&q=cache:NWgFOWmBDN4J:etd.lib.fsu.edu/theses/available/etd-07102007-
225407+%22get+the+spins%22+-+intoxicated Women's Voices on College Drinking: The
First-Year College Experience"]</ref> is an adverse reaction of intoxication
that causes a state of vertigo and nausea,<ref name="dartmouth">[[Dartmouth
College]]: [http://www.dartmouth.edu/~healthed/groups/dapa/otherdrugs/pot.html
"Marijuana / Cannabis"]</ref> causing one to feel as if he or she is "spinning
out of control".<ref name="battery">Patrick Gibson. patrickgibson.com:
[http://patrickgibson.com/news/archive/battery/ "Battery Review"]</ref> It is
most commonly associated with drunkenness<ref name="ragman">Pete Hautman. [http-
://books.google.com/books?hl=en&lr=&id=8lbBCe5TPq0C&oi=fnd&pg=PA11&dq=%22got+th-
e+spins%22&ots=Ju6D80nqS2&sig=vKCsddlApzdK5KGHCaoDJjsy0rw#PPA24,M1 Rag
Man]</ref> or mixing alcohol with other psychoactive drugs<ref
name="wwu">[[Western Washington University]] Prevention and Wellness Services:
[http://www.wwu.edu/chw/preventionandwellness/AODWebPDFs/Alcohol&OtherDrugInter-
actions.pdf "Alcohol and Drug Interactions"]</ref> such as cannabis. This state
is likely to cause vomiting,<ref name="binge">Linda C. Lederman, Lea P. Stewart,
Lisa Laitman, Fern Goodhart, & Richard Powell. ''The Higher Education Center for
Alcohol and Other Drug Prevention: [http://www.higheredcenter.org/files/product/case-
binge.pdf "A Case Against “Binge” as the Term of Choice: How to Get College
Students to Personalize Messages about Dangerous Drinking"]</ref> but having the
spins is not life-threatening unless pulmonary aspiration occurs.<ref
name="dartmouth"/>
wiki.title: spins
